mapper.select: select id, `start_at`, `end_at`, `min_payment`, `params`, created_at, updated_at, deleted_at from job_specs

select i.id, i.address, i.type, js.created_at, js.updated_at, js.deleted_at, js.params, xjr.result from (select address, max(id) as id from initiators where type = #{type} and deleted_at is null group by address) xi # ${type} inner join initiators i using (address, id) inner join job_specs js on i.job_spec_id = js.id left outer join (select distinct xjr.*, xtr.result from (select tr.job_run_id, tr.result from (select *, if(@prev <> itr.job_run_id , @rn:=0,@rn), @prev:=itr.job_run_id, @rn:=@rn+1 as rn from task_runs itr, (select @rn:=0) rn, (select @prev:='') prev order by itr.job_run_id asc, itr.task_spec_id desc) tr where tr.rn = 2) xtr right outer join (select jr.id, jr.job_spec_id from job_runs jr where jr.updated_at = (select max(updated_at) from job_runs ijr where ijr.job_spec_id = jr.job_spec_id)) xjr on xjr.id = xtr.job_run_id) xjr on xjr.job_spec_id = i.job_spec_id where js.deleted_at is null order by js.updated_at desc limit #{offset},#{limit}
select id, `start_at`, `end_at`, `min_payment`, `params`, created_at, updated_at, deleted_at from job_specs where `deleted_at` is null order by `created_at` desc limit #{offset},#{limit}
select count(1) from job_specs where `deleted_at` is null

select count(1) from (select job_spec_id, address, max(id) as id from initiators where type = #{type} and deleted_at is null group by address) xi inner join initiators i using (address, id) inner join job_specs js on i.job_spec_id = js.id where js.deleted_at is null
